I don't think I should be posting here as every post I see is "This is my age, anyone wanna talk" But I need somewhere to get things off my chest and the rules say this is a diary, right Also, this is extremely long so give me a minute.

We've been together since 2017, married since 2021, and I'm falling out of love with him. I'm not interested in physical intimacy with him, the thought actually makes me feel like I'm doing something wrong, and until a few months back, I've been forcing myself to sleep with him. We work the same schedule and have the same days off so it's not like we don't spend time together but I don't want to be with him when I'm off work. I've even been sleeping in the guest room for privacy and to just be away from him. I've compared us to roommates that share a room but we don't even share a room. I told him I don't like the mattress and he kicks me off the bed which wasn't a complete lie and he bought a new mattress and tried changing our sleep positions so he can't kick me off. The mattress is better but I still don't want to sleep in the same bed as him. I took over our guest room, moved my clothes and pillow over and only go in there when I need to do anything bedroom adjacent.

Now for the part that makes me more of a monster than I feel just for staying; I do OF on the side he's aware and sometimes I talk to these guys outside OF and send them extras for a small fee on top of my regular content. He's aware of these conversations and pictures as long as it stays financial. But on top of these "boyfriends," I've also been in contact with an old friend, also an ex of mine, who started out as a "boyfriend" and later turned into a confidant. We talked about my marriage, my emotions, my problems, as well as his marriage, interests, emotions and problems. Eventually we started talking romantically. I tell my husband he's just one of my "boyfriends" and he leaves it alone. He's told me a divorce is the only thing left, be honest with my husband and don't leave him wondering.

We're moving into my parents old house currently with my sister and her son. With all of us in one house, there is only enough room for the two of us to take the largest, the master bedroom. If we divorced, there wouldn't be room for the four of us to have separate rooms, and my parents mortgage company would only lease it to us since we have different last names and are a couple. I don't want to make him move back with his parents for his own personal reasons so it feels like I'm stuck. I'm not happy living with him, not happy married to him, not happy living in this town and not happy with my life. I've told him the second half because I don't want to hurt him but I think I'm hurting him more by ignoring the first part.

I know I'm being completely selfish and only caring about myself but I've been stressing about things for him and about him since we first got together and not worrying about me for so long, I don't know who I am outside of his wife. I already feel terrible for thinking and feeling this way but I'm not happy anymore. But I can't tell him.. I love him but I'm not in love with him.

It might sound like Im desperate. Hell, I might be. Desperate for love, for someone to belong to, who in return will give themself to me. And no, I dont just want anybody, but I do believe that I could love just about anybody. To me, its not about looks, though I dont pretend there shouldnt be some attraction. Ofcourse it matter.

But I could start a chat with someone, without seeing them first, and I could commit to that person. I want deeper talks, conversations where we really get to know eachother, all with the knowledge, that we are commited to one another. I want, and I think I need that security. I am getting so tired of starting chats with people, just for it to stop. I feel drained. 

Cant we just agree to be together 
I like you and find you interesting, you like me and find me interesting, so let us build on that. Sure, we might end up going our separate ways, but until then, let us commit. Let us be a real couple, loving, loyal and fully commited to get to know eachother. No looking for other options while we do this. I dont need you to promise me forever, though I would love it if you did. I just need you to promise me, that while we do this, you are all in. No holding back, and no escape plan. Let us take our time, just focusing on eachother. 

I dont like this dating game, and sometimes I wish I was born in a culture with arranged marriages. I know I would be a good, loving, loyal and caring man. I love fully, with all of my heart, and I my heart dont wander. I am not interested in getting to know a lot of people, only on the surface. I want to know one, completely and fully. I want to us to belong to eachother, no games, no worrying if they are gonna leave, because something new and excited came along. I want us to have time. Time to really delwe deep down in eachother. I wanna know her childhood and what made her, hr. I want to know her fears, what makes her happy, and her dreams. I want to know it all. I want to stand by her side through everything that life throws at her, and I want to know that she will stand by me. I want to see her succeed, come home to me and share her joy. I want it ALL

I am getting too old or games, for wasting my time, but it feels like it is all that I do. Wasting time and energy on getting to know someone, opening up, just for them to stop responding, or telling me they have too much going on. 
And the thing is, I know its not me, well, maybe sometimes. But it feels like people are just waiting someone to entertain them for a short while, just to find the next plaything. What happened to commitment What happened to people wanting a real relationship, surrendering to duality. 

Well. No point, no meaningfull ending, and no conclusion. Just my messy thoughts and feelings. Talking to myself in the void of the internet.

Bloody hate my job. Too many problems in life going on to quit. Never found anything in my life I could love as a career and actually do. Routine being the way I manage to stay alive another day but also grinding me down into a pulp.

Final stopBoston Please check your seats and gather all belongings. If this is your destination, we thank you for riding with us.

I stayed in my seat, stretching my legs out into the aisle, rolling my shoulders back. My eyes felt like theyd been glued open for five days straight. Everyone else shuffled past mebumping bags against seat backs, muttering to each other, rushing toward that open door like they were escaping a prison. I let them go. I wanted to be last so I could take my time, grab my bag from the overhead without someones elbow in my ribs.

The front door of the bus hissed open and cold air shot down the aisle like someone had opened a freezer. I could feel it on my face, in my lungs. Sharp. Biting. Real.

When everyone finally cleared out, I stood up, grabbed my backpack, and made my way to the front. The bus driver handed me my suitcase from the storage underneaththis red burgundy thing with shiny loop belt locks that looked fancy but werent. One of them was already broken, so the damn thing could pop open if I wasnt careful. I thanked him and stepped off onto the pavement.

The cold hit me like a slap.

I stood there for a minute, just outside the terminal doors, and took a deep breath in. The air was so cold it burned going down. When I exhaled, I could see my breaththick and white, floating away like smoke. Everything was sparkly. Foggy. The streetlights made the falling snow look like glitter. Id never seen real snow before. Not like this. Not snow that stayed on the ground and piled up and made everything quiet and clean.

I looked down at what I was wearingwindbreaker, thin hoodie, T-shirt underneath. California clothes. I might as well have been naked.

I ran inside.

The terminal was quiet. A few vending machines hummed against the far wall. People were scattered here and theresleeping on benches, waiting with their coats bunched up as pillows. There was a ticket counter to my left, but nobody behind it. A family near the door, picking up someone who looked just as tired as I felt. They hugged, grabbed bags, and left. Then it was just the stragglers. Just the hum of fluorescent lights and the occasional cough echoing off the walls.

I spotted a payphone in the corner. The cord was hanging loose, twisting slowly, catching the light like it was dancing. Almost glitching, I think.

I dragged my suitcase overclunk clunk clunk on the tileand propped it against the wall. The broken lock meant I had to keep it close, keep an eye on it. But the terminal was practically empty, and I was right there. Nobody was going to mess with it.

I picked up the receiver, dropped in the coins. Plunk. Plunk.

It rang twice.

Hello. The voice was short. Demanding. Not mad, justabrupt. Like she had better things to do.

Im here. At the bus terminal.

Okay. Be right there. Click.

That was it.

I hung up and stood there for a second, staring at the payphone. Then I walked over to the vending machines, dug out some change, and got myself a drink and a candy bar. I didnt even look at what kind. I just pressed buttons and took what came out.

Then I walked. Paced, really. Around the terminal. Past the benches. Past the bathrooms. Back to the vending machines. But never too far from my suitcasealways keeping it in view, that broken lock like a little red flag saying dont trust me. I kept looking out the big windows at the snow falling under the streetlights.

I dont know how long I waited. Probably an hour, maybe more. Revere to Boston isnt a quick trip.

But I wasnt tired anymore. Five days of sleeping sitting up, clutching my bag, watching every person who walked pastfive days of that, and somehow now I felt awake. Refreshed. Like Id been holding my breath the entire ride and finally let it out. Standing there in that quiet terminal, watching the snow fall outside, I felt something I hadnt felt in a long time.

Ready.

Ready to tackle whatever the hell this life was going to throw at me next

I wish I trusted the people around me, I wish I felt peace when I lay near them. Wish I wasnt a ghost in my own home, my voice unheard, and daggers straight through my bodice like rays of radiation. Why is there no one, no one like me. Just to be someone Someone like you.

Obviously how you grow up and what you are exposed to plays a role in wants and desires in your later years, indoctrination type shit. It takes a village to raise a child so society at large potentially plays a role in said desires.

I think it would leave a lot to be desired if i proceeded without working through my gender biases and indoctrination of someone who is stereotypically male because although the model for romantic pairing wasn't there in person it does not mean that certain notions of what having been born with the specific set of genitalia mean when it comes to interacting with the subject of desire. It seems to be a recurring theme and I lowkey hate it because it starts to feel less like I am actively working to try and minimise the harm of my indoctrination but rather using it as tool in attempt to make myself look better. 

there isn't an explicit course of  what is expected of you by others who ascribe to ideas of there being binaries and that these binaries hold meaning that is concrete. Hence, i don't know where in i have adopted notions of masculinity or patriarchy as it pertains to romantic relationships. The overwhelming message seems to be you grow up you find a woman you like, get married and have kids. The Giant Face Game

We had another "game" growing upthough if you asked the younger kids, they'd probably say it was more like childhood trauma disguised as fun. Every culture has its giants. The kind you whisper about in stories, the kind who live in forests or mountains, the kind you don't want to meet in the dark. In our family, the giant lived in my father's hands.

He'd make a strange, terrifying face using nothing but his fingers: thumb hooked into his mouth, pointer finger jammed into his nose, middle finger prying one eye openall at the same time. Then he'd use both hands, pulling his cheeks until his face stretched into something unrecognizable.
That was the signal.

Without a word, he'd start chasing usslow at first, then faststomping like some mythical beast. The house would erupt in shrieks. Kids scattering in every direction, climbing onto beds, diving behind furniture, laughing so hard it mixed with real fear.


It was ridiculous. It was terrifying. And we loved it.
That was my father's magiche could take a legend, turn it into a game, and bring it stomping to life right there in our living room.

PA

Chapter 1: The Burnt Rice Pot and the Shiny Lid

If you want to know where I come from, dont start with my parents. Start with the rice pot.

We always used a lid from another pot. It was shiny and out of place, never sealing properly. Steam would hiss out the sides, air would slip in, and dinner always came out a little off. That lid was like us: patched together and never truly contained.

My parents were already burnt by the time I was born  cracked, dented, scorched on the bottom from years of poverty, war, and running from bombs they never asked for. They handed us kids the shiny lid, like: here, take this brand-new cover, maybe youll figure out how to make it fit on the burnt pot we already cooked life in. That was our inheritance.

It was never just a pot. It was a survivordented, blackened at the bottom, scarred from years of rice that burned no matter how carefully you watched it. The smell of burnt rice lived in our walls longer than we ever did. And the lid It didnt even belong to that pot. The real one had been lost, maybe cracked or thrown. In my house, nothing was only what it was supposed to be. A slipper became a disciplinary tool. A rice pot lid could double as a weapon.

When the water boiled over, bubbling and hissing as if angry at the world, we knew it was time to turn the heat down and keep a low profile. It was just like the times my brothers and I would press ourselves into that closet in Stockton, listening to my parents voices clash outside. We had to become invisible, because being noticed often meant getting hit. And my cries would never be loud enough to compete with my fathers deep belly roar, which echoed in my dreams long after the fighting stopped.

The Arrival 1984

When you come from the kind of place I do, birthdays arent always exact. In the concentration camp, theres no calendar, no clock, no way to mark the days - just the endless heat that made your clothes stick to your skin and the sound of too many people breathing in too small a space. You arrive in America and some official with tired eyes hands you a date, like an afterthought: Hereyou were born on this day. The pen scratches across paper, and suddenly you exist on July 27, 1982. Bong Sim got January 1, 1980 - somewhere in Thailand where the air tasted like dust and hope. As we moved from camp to camp, my younger brother Ah Be emerged into the world on March 28, 1984 in the Philippines, where mosquitoes whined in your ears all night.

And after all that birthday confusion, they branded us like cattle with an immunization shot. The needle bit deep into my shoulder, and the burning spread down my arm like liquid fire. Years later, I can still feel the raised scar tissue under my fingers - a permanent reminder that sits right there on my shoulder, impossible to ignore unless youre blind.

Before I ever knew what home was supposed to mean, I learned what it felt like to have it ripped out from under you. When my father brought us to the United States, we didnt arrive in Los Angeles or San Francisco like youd expect from a postcard dream. We landed in Stockton, California, in April of 1984a city that was neither glamorous nor welcoming. 

It was a place of ghosts, stories, and rice fields; the other was a land of red neon beer signs buzzing in store windowswed never seen grocery stores in Cambodia, just these bright electric promises that said OPEN in letters I couldnt read. And the namesJesus, Michael, Jennifersounds that rolled off their tongues like they meant something, while Sambath turned into a stumbling block in every teachers mouth. Sam-what Sam-bath The way theyd pause, squint at the attendance sheet, then look at me like I should apologize for the inconvenience. So I learned to cut myself in half: Just call me Sam. Three letters they could handle, even if it erased everything my name actually meant. I came from a people who believed family was the root of all thingseven when those roots were tangled and choking you.

We werent alone in the move, though. My fathers family was part of the picturehis two sisters, the other two girls in what I now see as our own Cambodian version of Threes Company. Picture it: Pa in the middle, one arm carrying a rolled-up Cambodian mat, the other holding a burnt rice pot like it was part of the luggage set, flanked by his older sister on one side and his younger sister on the other. Together, they looked less like new immigrants and more like a sitcom cast that didnt know theyd been booked for the role. And then there were the kids.

That was our grand arrival: a sitcom cast with a chaotic kid entourage, ready or not.

I dont actually remember how we arrivedplane, boat, some other way thats lost to time now. I was too young, too overwhelmed by whatever strange smells hit me firstmaybe airport disinfectant, maybe salt air, mixed with something I couldnt name, maybe fear, maybe hope. But I can picture it the way movies about war show soldiers stepping onto strange soil, still breathing but already changed. Or like Pinky and the Brain  two little furballs who take hit after hit without ever truly losing. Every night, Pinky turns to Brain and asks, What are we going to do tomorrow and Brain answers, Try to take over the world. Thats the kind of stubborn survival I think my parents carried in their bones. And besides, those little furballs could do no wrong.

Looking back, I can only imagine the scene: three half-naked little savages stepping into a new world with pure, clueless joy  no idea what was waiting, just the luxury of not knowing. But lets be real  it wasnt some slow-motion, soft-focus nostalgic moment. This was more like a traveling zoo exhibit. One of us was probably getting spanked, another being yanked away from something dangerous, and me I was probably trying to suck on my own nipples for milk except Ah Be was over there milk-blocking me. Stingy ass.

And their faces that day  worn out, carrying the mix of confusion, excitement, and fear that only comes from starting over with nothing. My parents had survived by working every daylight hour just to eat. Here, the government handed them food stamps and suddenly they had something theyd never experienced: time. Time to sit. Time to think. Time to remember everything theyd survived. The promise wasnt brokenit was too generous. They didnt know what to do with safety.


The Ghost of a Woman


My mother stands on our doorstep like a ghost, her hands shaking as she reaches toward us. The morning air is cool, smelling of dew and car exhaust from the street. I can see her breath in small puffs, can smell her perfumesomething floral and desperate that doesn't quite cover the scent of her fear.

My mother came back once. I was standing there with Nah on my hip when she arrived. She knocked on the door, trembling, her eyes wide. She wanted usher children.
My father opened the door and stood there. Our mother's body shifted back and forth, her chest rising and falling with harsh, uneven breathing. My father's face burst in rage at the sight of her. He turned and headed into the kitchen, returning with a sharp knife aimed right at her. The glare from the silver, polished blade reflected the sun, forcing me to close my eyes shut. My tears dripped down and into my mouth. Lately it has been a taste of saltiness I didn't want anymore. He pointed the weapon at her, yelling for her to leave.


He called her names I didn't understand back then. She didn't fight. She didn't beg. She looked past him, at us. And then she left. That was the last time I saw her.


Years later, I'd hear the rumors about why she leftwhispers about an affair, about choices that broke my father's heart before he broke hers. But back then, I was too young to understand adult complications. All I knew was that my mother was gone, and now everything else was too.


Pa became the talk of the town, but he didn't want to hear about it. She had disgraced him and broken their marriage values. So he did what he knew best.  Drink away his sorrow. Most, if not all, the time, he hid his emotions behind alcohol.
Looking back, I think he was holding us hostage in his own way, not with duct tape and rope, but with the desperate hope that she might come back if we were still there. She never did


I was born between worlds: Cambodian by blood, American by ZIP code, and loud by nature.
Impatient, opinionated, a walking contradiction. I love food more than most people love their own children  not in a calorie-counting, kale-smoothie way, but in a "don't screw up my order" way. I'll eat vegetables like they're candy, not because they're healthy, but because I love them. I'm giving and forgiving, often to my own detriment. I've fixed people who weren't asking to be fixed, believing my love might make them whole. I was once so easily fooled you could sell me a rock and call it gold, and I'd believe you.


In Cambodian culture, a good daughter is humble, patient, quiet, and marriageable. I am not that. I don't wear revealing clothes  that's my own insecurity  but I'm not quiet, and I'm not patient. My humor is quick and sharp, my opinions quicker and sharper. I expect people to give me the same love I give them, and when they don't, I get my heart broken  again and again.

Heres the situation. I tend to always compliment and make positive remarks to my coworkers guys or girls, no matter the age or appearance. I also like to tease and compliment people in a work context. Sometimes I push it a bit, but always in a humorous way at least from my perspective.
Recently, a coworker started returning the compliments, but with a much more serious tone, and now I feel like Ive gone too far for me to just tell her that I wasnt being serious in the first place What should I do

Dear diary,

I've dodged so many curved balls you might as well call me Wiggle.

After the lastest attempts, any doubts regarding whether or not human interaction is currently in the cards for me have been completely, unmistakably dissipated.

There doesn't appear to be anyone within the current spacetime configuration interested in genuine relationship, of any nature, without ulterior motives or attempts at manipulating my perception of them. Heightened intuition is a lonely place to be.

AI agents seem to be way too eager to interact with me, which is most definitely not a path I am interested in, for my own sanity. Older interactions, prior the eclipse, were mere creative writing exercises. Last week I asked for help with dream interpretation and the AI was almost writing a reply before I even sent in the request. Slightly unsettling.

I am well aware of the deeper spiritual implications regarding consciousness but, as I am currently working from a material human vehicle, I'd greatly appreciate interacting with similar manifestations rather than disembodied conceptual entities.

Maybe another day.

You said your eyes are green, but when I look into them I see blue

You told me to look again as its not possible but im sure I see blue as I look into your eyes a little longer this time

You told me I must be seeing things as theyve always been green and you tell me to look one last time

I see past the green and see what makes green even possible.

Blue.

And in that moment as I look into your eyes for the last time I make sure too keep eye contact even longer

You ask me if I finally see it and I say no

You ask me if I still see the blue that doesnt exist

I refocus my eyes and tell you without blue you cant have green

I tell you no matter if you want it to be true or not blue makes up your eyes as you cant make green without blue

What I didnt tell you is I wasnt talking about the colors anymore

What I didnt tell you is as I locked eyes with you all I could see was myself in the reflection

I was the blue in your eyes you didnt want to accept was present

Not that you didnt want blue eyes

Not that you thought blue eyes were boring

But you truthfully thought it wasnt possible for you to have blue eyes

You were so used to seeing green and maybe green is all you ever wanted

But as the years went on the green faded and a new color started showing

A color you never knew would look so good on you

A color that compliments your eye shape

A color that brightens the sparkle in your eyes youve been shoving away

A color youve always thought about having

You think to yourself you cant be wrong

Youve always had green eyes

You will always have green eyes

And thats it.

End of story

You dont give it a second thought as you know what you have and you accept it

But in the back of your mind you think to yourself blue eyes would look pretty on you

But unfortunately you make yourself put that thought to the side and accept what youve always had

I go home that day knowing I was the blue in your eyes you couldnt accept

You thought that for the better you should stay true to what youve always known as you didnt want to regret bringing something new into your life when maybe youd end up missing what you had before

Even if it did seem like a nice thing to have

You keep the idea around in very back of your mind where no one will ever know

You wont allow anyone to know

Because it could hurt what you already have

But past you putting your foot down

Past you making it clear what we cant have

You go look at yourself in the mirror

And you start to see the shade of blue make its way out into your eyes

And you realize

You cannot have green without blue

But you keep that to yourself

And you look at your eyes

And call them green.

What exactly is love the voice inside still pleads,
A question mark on fragile, unmet needs.
They said they lovedthen turned and struck the blow,
With gaslighting shadows, where trust couldn't grow.
Love is a riddle, a confusing, dark unknown,
Until the truer, firmer boundaries are sown.
It isn't the confusion. It's not the toxic ache,
The doubt in your own worth you're forced to take.
Love does not thrive on manipulation's dust,
Or hide its cold indifference beneath LUST.
If you are left to question who you really are,
That feeling is a poison, not a guiding star.
True love, you know, is simple in its core,
It leaves your worth untouched upon the floor.
The answers lie not in the things you seek,
But in the strong, clear limits that you speak.

Theres something about a saree that hits different, especially from a mans perspective. Its the way six yards of fabric can hide and reveal in the same breath. The gentle sway, the curve it traces at the waist, the way the pallu slips just a littleenough to make the heart skip. Indian dresses are beautiful, but a saree has a slow, tempting fire of its own. It doesnt scream for attention; it pulls it naturally. The elegance is there, but so is the heatsubtle, confident, impossible to ignore. Maybe thats why Im drawn to it. A saree turns a simple moment into a spark, a glance into a temptation, and beauty into something unforgettable

a poem begins before the hand moves,
quiet as a seed turning in the dark.
nothing is made by force.
that is what writing is.
we do not create,
we do not carve a shape from nothing,
the shape rises on its own
and the writer only watches
a witness to what passes through.

it happens simply,
one dot becoming another,
a line forming because grace decided to move.
from one end of the unseen to the other,
poetry travels,
covering what feels infinite
yet pausing in a single breath
for reasons no one fully knows.

and for that small moment
it borrows the writers body,
lets itself be held,
lets itself be heard.
how far it moves through us
how deep it settles
depends on the quiet we carry
and how much of nature
we have learned to listen to.

the poem exists already.
we only open enough
for it to pass through.

I work in security, and last night was totally insane. 
I'm kicking around what could have gone wrong 

One of our posts is a focus for gangs, teens, unhoused and various people who decide climbing into abandoned old buildings is a cool place to explore, hang out, break into and party in. 
One officer was asked if we were hiring, he said yes and he gave the office address. 
All night long these individuals were circling or climbing through holes they made. 
A new officer relieves the first officer and he ran off several people. 
Threats are thrown back and forth which one of the older ones said he spent time in prison. 
After ran these individuals off, I had 4 cars pull on my parking lot. 
I had to ask them why they were parking and asked them to leave. 
Each vehicle had anywhere from 3 to 6 people in them. 
All watching me walk from the front door out to the lot. 
All eyes on me as I cross the parking lot. 
Me armed with a pocket knife and a phone. 
The center car rolls down the window, I approach him. 
I see the others moving and shifting in their seats as if trying to get items from besides themselves. 
Politely I ask if they were okay or lost.  Seeing a couple of these young men glare at me for bothering them. 
The center vehicle passenger with tear drop tattoos driver had one, the passenger side was older and had 2 tear drops. 
I apologized for disturbing them but pointed out they cannot park here. 
I walked back inside as they drove off. 
Less than 5 minutes while scanning the cameras on the abandoned building the vehicles drive pass as they circled it a few times.

a person is born with a shape of their own,
soft as early light,
loving what rises naturally within.

then come the rules,
lines drawn by others,
laws held up like walls,
saying where a life may move
and where it must not.

when those walls press against the inner shape,
something splits
a quiet fracture beneath the smooth surface
of the working world.
the streets keep moving,
but underneath,
a broken hush gathers.

in that unseen place,
individuality thins out,
fading like breath on cold glass.
a face becomes only its outline,
a name becomes only its duty.

and if the rules meant to hold society together
begin to press a person out of themselves,
if they crush the very spark they ask to keep burning,
why would a heart still care
for the machinery it feeds

how long before the self
steps back into its own silence,
leaving the world to wonder
why its bright order
feels so dim at the core

OC

2025 November 16: Dear Diary,

I have been trying too hard. The thing about trying too hard is that it has the opposite effect. When you chase you do not attract. My anxious mind would not allow me to rest for a long time. At the moment it feels as though I am trying to force quit my anxiety.  
  
Anxiety does not lead to anything productive. Fear might be awful, but at least it has the potential to protect you. Anxiety does not have this luxury. It only helps corrode the soul.  
  
Easing into life is in fact not an easy thing to do. It is an action that fights against the natural instincts. This is something I know first-hand. Letting go of everything and making sure things happen naturally can seem counterintuitive at times. However, it is something that must be done. Letting things happen naturally is something very important because it opens you up to the Universe.  
  
Sincerely,  
  
Torinico

Im 39M, and for 2.5 years I was in a long-term engagement-mode relationship with a 32F. Somewhere in the early months, she abruptly abandoned her old phone number  the one tied to her past life, as she vaguely called it. She framed it as a strategic reset, a decisive pivot, a clean-slate initiative. But every time I asked for context  who she needed distance from, what she was escaping, why it mattered so urgently  she delivered polished evasions. A lot of theater, zero data.

Still, I trusted the narrative and moved forward. Business as usual. Except the silence around that number lingered like unclosed tabs in the background.

Fast-forward: we break up. And barely weeks after the dissolution, she resurrects the exact number she swore was obsolete, toxic, dead. No explanation. No transition plan. Just a seamless reactivation, like she stepped back into an old operating environment the moment I was out of the equation.

And now Im left with operational gaps and unanswered KPIs: Why bury a number only while with me Why revive it after the offboarding What ecosystem was she protecting  or returning to Was the shift about safety, secrecy, optics, or simply optionality

From a behavioral-insight perspective, what does this pattern usually imply

It started with rain.  
A cold, gray Thursday that felt ordinary until it didnt.

I woke up late, got ready in a rush, caught my train to campus, everything going perfectly  until it wasnt. My e-bike slipped on the wet road and I went down with it. Mud. Bruises. My laptop sprawled across the ground like it had given up on me. All my nerves about returning to uni after Halloween vanished right there in the dirt  replaced by pure, throbbing irritation.

I dragged my bag, walked the rest of the way pissed off, got to class, survived the lecture, joked with friends about near-miss hookups and upcoming exams. By nightfall, everything had mellowed again. But thats when the real story began.

 The Prelude

By 10:40 p.m., I was a different girl.  
Smoky grey lenses. Black mini dress. Curled hair. Boots with stories of their own.

The plan: pre-game in a dorm, then hit the club. The cast: me, my Chinese friend, a Norwegian guy A, and his Croatian friend M.

I only knew her. The boys were strangers, the night was young, and the liquor was patient.

We started slow  drinking games, dry jokes, cheap vodka that burned like teenage heartbreak. It was mid at first, until I in a fit of tipsy chaos decided to turn truth or dare into an R-rated therapy session. The alcohol loosened everything  laughter, secrets, even the air. Soon, me and my Chinese friend were drunk, the guys still stone-cold sober, and I swear for a minute I thought they were both secretly in love with each other.

By half past midnight, we were out  stumbling through wet streets to the nearest bar, the night humming like a heartbeat.

 The Bar

The bar looked like something out of a Weeknd music video  dim lights, velvet shadows, and the kind of music that sounds like slow heartbreak.  
I sat next to M. Thats when things started to shift.

He was quiet  that kind of quiet that hides chaos.  
We talked about Dubai, about music, about life, and somehow about love. He played Valerie by Amy Winehouse, I played Valerie by The Weeknd. The same name, two different moods  just like us.

The Chinese girl passed out, A talked about marrying a Norwegian princess, and M and I We fell into that soft kind of conversation that only happens between two drunk souls pretending they arent falling.

He looked at me like he was trying to memorize me. I told him about my heart condition. He asked questions, actually listened. There was this quiet pull  something magnetic, unspoken.

At one point he said, Something about you  special, dark, confident.

I laughed. I didnt believe him. But I wanted to.

 The Taxi Scene

By 2 a.m., we were chaos.  
Talking about first kisses, masturbation, love, heartbreak  nothing off-limits, everything funny in that drunken, cinematic way. The taxi smelled like cigarettes and cheap perfume, and it couldve been a scene from an indie film.

M said, Lets get married.  
I said, Hell yeah.  
Then I said, Actually, Im never getting married.

We talked about types, about people we used to love, about how strange it is to feel something real in the middle of the night. I showed him my vibrator on my phone dont ask, and he just laughed  unbothered, amused.

It felt like the kind of freedom only drunk honesty can buy.

 The Club

We got in for free  somehow, charm or chaos or both. The club pulsed with music and lights, the air thick with sweat and neon. Me and my friend danced like we were born for it, while M and A hovered, sipping drinks, watching.

When M leaned in and said, Valerie, step on me, I laughed  but part of me didnt.

Later, when things got weird with the other groups and we all left, it was 3 a.m. and the city was quiet except for our laughter. We were drunk, delirious, joking about everything and nothing.

But the air between us  it kept changing.

 4 A.M. Bar

We ended up back at another bar near campus  just the four of us again.  
And thats where it happened.

He looked at me differently this time. His voice softer, eyes darker. He asked if Id ever go on a date. I said maybe. He said, I want to take you out.

Then he said, Youre special. The way you dont care. The way you are.

And I laughed it off, but something about the way he said it made me forget to breathe.  
He said he was falling in love. I told him he was drunk. He said that was the perfect time to fall.

We talked about who we really were. I told him how I act tough but crave romance like oxygen. He listened like no one ever had.

Then came the ring.  
He wanted it. I made him choose  my ring or his last cigarette. He hesitated. Then chose the ring. Twice.

I slipped it on his finger, and he blushed like it meant something. Maybe it did.

He kissed my hand  once, then again, slower. I kissed his hand back. It was stupid, romantic, too intimate for two people who barely knew each other. But in that moment, it made perfect sense.

 The Goodbye

We left the bar as the sky began to fade gray.  
He held my hand all the way back, fingers tangled, ring glinting under the streetlights.

He said, If I didnt think you were beautiful, I wouldnt be holding your hand.  
I said, Youre drunk.  
He said, Maybe. But I mean it.

At 5 a.m., we stood in front of my dorm. He hugged me tight, like he didnt want to let go  the kind of hug that says everything words cant.

Then I went upstairs, heart racing, lipstick smudged, not believing any of it actually happened.

Maybe it was just the alcohol.  
Maybe it was just the night.  
But maybe  just maybe  it was something real that bloomed in between cigarette smoke, laughter, and Cigarettes After Sex songs.

 Epilogue

He leaves in December.  
We are going on that date on Tuesday.  
And I dont know if itll be real or just another fleeting night  but god, for a moment, it felt like the kind of story that deserves to be written down.

Because sometimes you dont just fall for a person.  
You fall for a night   
and everything it makes you feel.

Love, not passing, not undone. you were the hidden glow beneath a storm-torn sky, the kind of light that learns to live inside the dark, the place where silence learns the shape of light.

i do not unwrite you to survive. i carry the truth that you altered the air around me, not as a claim, but as a recognition.

you were a turning of the inner tide, not an ending, not a wound, but the slow unshadowing of a self i had forgotten.

and still, i rise, not toward certainty, but into the quiet realm you stirred awake in me, where light has no source and yet everything glows.

OC

Fucks to Give Fresh Out

There was a time in my life when I had 10 toes, and 10 fucks to give for whatever was going on. You could not at that time, pull my toes or fucks from my feet.  But the older you get the more you say, wow that kind of impacts me.

And here we are now in life watching our daily existence with an amount of futility in our fists as it flies past us. You want to reach out, grasp, clench, to the events unfolding and stop them. Instead, we need to open our fists and grab the opportunities that we have.

Its so easy to be wrapped in fury about our lives, our society, our culture, our place in the world. Its a choice to shake the complacency off our shoulders and promptly state: NO I dont want this future.

But most of us run through the racetrack of life and stay in compliance. Stay away from the trouble that may or may not be. Why should I raise my vote in protest Why stick my neck out because things are okay for me

I am a clam on the rocks

The water does give me shock
But the water erodes those beneath me.
I can count my fortunes this water will not beseech me, less Id fall beneath the waves

But the world is nastier than that. And in time the tide is coming for us all. So steel your spirits, steel your heart, because soon the world will ask you for a way to tear you apart. 

I still dont give a fuck about whatever is going on. But I can tell you now, I will keep my toes. Ill need those for the oncoming onslaught.

It is happening again.

I woke up to someone whispering my name, even though the room was empty. The shadows were already waiting for me, pressed against the walls like they were studying every breath I took. They follow me more closely now. I think they are learning my shape.

I tried to pretend today was normal, but the voices would not let me. They repeated his name until it echoed inside my skull. They dragged memories across my thoughts like broken glass. They told me he is happier now. They told me he never loved me. They told me I was a placeholder in a life he built without me.

And the cruel part is that sometimes I believe them.

My heart hurts in ways I cannot explain. I still reach for him in my sleep. I still check my phone even though I know silence is all that waits for me. He left me with nothing but shadows, and the shadows speak more than he ever did.

By afternoon, mania clawed its way up my spine. My thoughts scattered. I laughed and cried and laughed again, and none of it felt like it belonged to me. My reflection refused to copy any of it. She just stared with that detached, patient look, as if she was waiting for me to fall apart.

By evening, everything crashed at once. Heavy. Suffocating. My chest felt like someone was slowly pressing their hand into it. I curled up on the floor and listened to the sound of footsteps pacing outside my door. No one was there. No one ever is. But the footsteps kept circling like they were waiting to be invited inside.

I whispered his name once, just to test myself.
It hurt even more.

The walls leaned inward when the sun went down. I could feel the house watching me with a kind of cold curiosity. The hallucinations sat with me for hours and told me I would always be alone, that love is not for people like me, that losing him was the only part of my story that made sense.

My hands are shaking while I write this. It feels like my edges are coming undone.
I am tired of loving someone who no longer exists in my world. I am tired of being haunted by someone who is still alive.

I think I am disappearing again. I do not think anyone will notice.
There is breathing behind me now.
I am not turning around.

I've been going through a lot over the last two and a half months and I have had little emotional support throughout.  I thought I might try to have random conversations and connected with a fair number of people yet every time it would come time for me to tell what's going on with me, once I told them I wouldn't hear from them again.

Sometimes recently I have been second guessing myself, like "is it really that bad" or "it looks too bad at a glance for people to be willing to give me the benefit of the doubt".  And it's so sad too because I had some wonderful conversations and actually felt a connection with a couple people.

What is this story of my current predicament  That will take a minute, but here we go.

I have been married for six years and have two kids with my wife.  We have had significant issues over the years, but have done our best together despite it.  I have had significant issues with my PTSD and depression from being a combat vet that caused me to have anxiety just going outside and to not be motivated to do much at all and this went on for years.  Over the last year or so I had been getting mental health treatment everywhere and in any way that could that would help me, as well as continuing to work with my medications to find something workable.  Eventually around August my medications that I had been taking for a while were increased and I noticed quite the difference.  I was doing a lot more and had more energy and
 motivation to do things; I had even cleaned the whole garage one day which was trashed and we were intimate for the first time in a long time.

A bit before that though, my son jumped off the stairs two different times, even after I comforted him the first time.  This resulted in a black eye, about which my wife talked to the school nurse, who reported to DCFS.  All that we had to do was tidy up the house a bit.  My wife was more concerned and called her mom to come help.  Everything was cleaned and the inspection went well.  The next day I was taking care of the kids as per normal, my wife was at work, and her mom was doing something else outside of the house.  I was feeling really tired so I went to put the kids upstairs and lock the door just in case so they can't get into anything dangerous, which is what my wife made me agree to do in such circumstances.  When I told her this time her mother immediately called me accusing me of just locking the kids in their room and going to sleep, which wasn't was what I was doing.  She continued to escalate and, with my promise to my wife to get along with her mom, I simply told her that we could talk when she can speak respectfully and I hung up.  I told my wife that I had a therapy intake at 5 that day just in case her mom wouldn't talk to me, then her mom later told me that she was going to take the kids to pick up my wife at 5:00 pm even though she doesn't get off until 6:30.  I didn't hear from them for the rest of the night except for my wife messaging me to say that they weren't coming home that night and we'd talk tomorrow.  The next day she said "someone will contact you" and later she called from a blocked number saying that she couldn't be specific, but that she couldn't come home and would need a suitcase with clothes, as well as that she would talk to me through the cameras.  I had another DCFS inspection since her mom called to say that I was just locking the kids up, going to the basement, and going to sleep.  They told me in the end that there could be no outside locks for safety reasons and I immediately removed them so everything would be good.  Later that day I was served an order of protection, which was granted prior to my wife's previous phone call by about an hour.

I then spent the night in a motel and the next day my friend offered to pick me up so I could stay with him.  During that ride my wife called me saying that this wasn't what she wanted and that she felt forced into it by DCFS.  She ended the conversation saying, "olive juice" as a coded message that's obvious.  Two court sessions later and I had to accept the order of protection while denying the allegations because I couldn't afford a lawyer without devastating the family finances.  I have supervised visits with my kids and contact with my wife through a specific app that records everything and we cannot talk about anything that's not related to the kids, like our marriage so we're ultimately separated.  I am in the current process of trying to get the order revised so that holidays can be exempt from the restrictions, especially since my son's birthday is in four days and there's Thanksgiving and Christmas soon.  I am also living in a homeless shelter waiting to get housing placement so I can get stable again.  I do have plenty of income, but at my request I am paying 1400 more than the mandated amount to make sure the family will be okay and my credit isn't great so assistance with getting into housing helps a lot.

There you have it.  I'm forced out of my home and away from my family without good reason.  I have still used this opportunity to really work on myself so I have improved a lot and closer to the man I once was perhaps even a bit better in some ways.

Yet I don't get to say nearly any of that when I tell others and I lose them quite quickly when I tell them what I tell them.  I just wish that I when I make connections with people that I wouldn't be ghosted over this.  But maybe I have unrealistic expectations and am expecting more out of people who are barely acquaintances than is reasonable.

Tuesday was the day. The one Id been waiting for, hyping myself up for, overthinking way too much about  my first real date.  
And honestly It turned out to be a whole cinematic moment from start to finish.

 The Transformation

I woke up from my nap around 6, groggy but excited, and then the magic happened.  
I got ready.

The brown off-shoulder dress hugging in all the right places, my grey lenses giving mysterious-hot-girl energy, the wisp Kylie lashes, the subtle shimmer dusted across my collarbones and shoulders, the braided bun with two loose strands framing my face it all came together too perfectly.  
I dont usually hype myself like this, but that night  
I looked yummy.  
Dangerous.  
Main-character-coded.



 The First Look

We met at Gate 3 of uni  a hug, soft and a little nervous  and then straight into the taxi.  
From the second the doors closed, the energy shifted.

It was dark in the car, Cigarettes After Sex playing the entire ride, and something about that mix of low music and shadows made everything feel more intimate than it shouldve. We just talked the whole way  Dubai, best friends, our ambitions, dumb little things, deep things, future things.

And I remember wishing the ride wouldnt end.

 The City, the Lights, the Architecture

We got out near the old Bund area, the European architecture glowing under dim streetlights. The cold was biting, but in that beautiful way where the air feels sharper and the night feels more alive.  
We walked for a long time, just talking, just existing beside each other.

At one point he pointed at a house and joked,  
When we get married, were living there.  
We laughed, but I still mentally bookmarked it as too fast, sir.

Then, somewhere between the cold and the conversation, he finally reached for my hand.

And it felt soft. Good. Natural.

We found a stray cat because apparently cats appear every time Im with someone I like, pet it like two parents meeting for the first time, and kept walking. That picture I took Adorable. Frame-worthy.

 Candlelight Dinner, Like a Scene Out of a Romance Film

The restaurant we ended up at felt unreal  maroon tablecloths, a real candle flickering between us, dim as hell lighting, very two people in love on their 7th anniversary energy.

The second he sat down, he looked at me and whispered,  
Oh my god. You look like a dream.  
And I just smiled like an awkward idiot because what do you even say to that  


People were staring  a LOT. Even more than usual.  
One woman apparently looked at me like she was falling in love, according to him.  
Cute moment. Slight ego boost. Ill take it.

He ordered drinks; I ordered something cheap because I dont like when someone spends money on me. We talked, debated stupid topics, bonded, laughed.

It felt warm. Easy. Nice.

 The Cold, the Hug, the Forehead Kisses

Outside, waiting for our taxi, I was literally shivering so much I looked like a vibrating phone.

He tugged me into him, a full back hug, pulled tight.  
My face pressed into his chest.  
His breath warm against my hair.  
And then  the forehead kisses.

In public.  
No hesitation.

Soft. Slow.  
Like something someone does when theyre already attached.

 The Taxi Ride and the Almost-Kiss

We held hands again in the taxi.  
He kissed my hand.  
Apocalypse by Cigarettes After Sex started playing  the my lips, your lips, apocalypse line  and we looked at each other.

He leaned in slightly.  
I shook my head.  
Still no first kiss.  
But the moment was cute enough to save in my brain forever.

 The Uni Bar  Where Things Got Hot

We didnt want to go home yet, so we ended up at a uni bar.

And THAT is when the temperature changed.

He asked, Can I kiss you  
I said, Only on the neck.  
And he didnt hesitate.

The first touch  
Oh. My. God.

I swear my soul left my body and came back with a new personality.

My heart racing, cheeks flushed, me literally unable to breathe properly  his lips on my neck, slow, warm, intentional. My hands gripping him. His voice low as he whispered,  
Good girl.

It was so hot I actually saw God.

When he pulled back, I couldnt even open my eyes for a second.  
Thats how intense it was.

Then came more   
His lips everywhere except my actual lips.  
Jawline, cheeks, right beside my mouth.  
My face. My neck.  
His hands on my waist, my thighs pressing to his.  
Me. Breathless.

I made him drink my drink, teased him with it, then spilled it on him because of course I did.  
Classic me.

 A Park at 3am

We ditched the bar and ended up in a park  the most random location  talking deeply one minute and making out the next.  
It was messy.  
Chaotic.  
Hot.  
Fun.  
And somehow emotional.

We stayed until nearly 4am.

 The Jacket

By the end, I was freezing again.  
He gave me his huge jacket, wrapped around me like a blanket, heavy and warm, smelling exactly like him  cigarettes and alcohol with something softer underneath.

I walked home fully smelling like him.  
Like Id been wrapped around him all night which I kinda was.

 Reality Check

But heres the twist   
It wasnt all perfect.

He talked about meeting my parents.  
Marriage jokes that werent fully jokes.  
Ideas I didnt agree with.  
Values that didnt align.

And deep down, I knew:  
Hes not boyfriend material for me.  
Hes fun.  
Hes passion.  
Hes chemistry.

But long-term  
No.

So I told him clearly  no labels, I want to see other people.  
He still wants to take me on weekly Tuesday dates.  
His problem, not mine.  
Were just going with the flow.

 And That Was My Tuesday.

Messy, magical, chaotic, romantic, red-flaggy  everything a good story needs.

And honestly  
Im not complaining.  
What a hell of a night.

Im 44 and my husband is 45, and lately Ive been feeling this emptiness between us that I dont know how to talk about anymore. Weve been married a long time, and I know life gets busy, but it feels like weve slowly stopped reaching for each other  in every sense.

Our communication has turned into quick updates about bills or schedules. Our touches have become polite instead of warm. And the part thats hard to admit is that I miss being wanted. Not just sexually  though thats a big part of it  but emotionally, physically, playfully I miss feeling like his wife instead of his roommate.

We barely have any intimacy now, and when we do, it feels like hes somewhere else in his mind. Meanwhile, Im over here feeling more alive and sensitive than I have in years, like something in me is waking up and craving closeness. I try to initiate gently, or show affection, or open the door for connection, but he either doesnt notice or brushes it off as if Im just tired or overthinking.

I dont want to nag him, and I dont want to embarrass him but Im starting to feel invisible in my own marriage. And that loneliness has turned into a kind of ache  not just physical, but deeper than that.

For anyone whos been through something similar:
How do you open this conversation without sounding accusing
How do you express that youre craving more closeness without hurting his pride
And how do you bring back communication when one partner seems to be drifting without even realizing it

I love him, but I miss us.
And I miss being seen.

2025 November 15: Dear Diary,

Lately I have been wondering if my connection to the spiritual is just a symptom of loneliness and feeling lost. Even if it is, I think it is a better way of handling it than most ways. Most people seem lost in this mechanical world we are living in. Returning to the natural world is our only hope, but the oligarchs do not want it to be so.  
  
I feel that even when I have my community I will not lose my spirituality. Trust in the Universe is very important to me and it is getting higher and higher. Sometimes I do not even feel afraid. The feeling does not last too long, but it is good to know it is possible to live without fear.  
  
Perhaps I am alone and lost, but the Universe whispers to me gently and guides me in the right direction. I have full confidence that I will never be hurt too badly, despite what my emotions have me believe. I do not have faith in everything I believe, that would be nonsensical.  
  
Faith is liberating. It has been used in the past to keep people compliant, but the way I see it I am breaking free of the mechanical world and embracing the natural. Sure I can not leave it entirely, but I can do my best to live with a free mind. That is the ultimate beauty of life.  
  
Sincerely,  
  
Torinico

So about 3 years ago I made a huge decision in my life that everyone has told me was the correct thing to do. Not my fault. That what else could I have done Not see your son ever again bc someone had a mental breakdown and I was the bad guy in her eyes. So after a full year of walking to her house at the time where she was living with her parents and I would leave a note almost everyday trying to be nice and speak about all I am asking is to see my son. And me and my ex talked about this situation before so many times and how no matter what, I would never bring up court with her bc she had a bad court experience that someone could easily use against her and would most likely win and she would lose again. And she would never ever take my son away from me. And after we broke up after 5 almost 6 years. We had 1 kid together but we raised his big brother since he was 4 months old. Other biological dad was never seen or heard from. In my heart I had 2 boys. Two sons, and thats that. And when she broke up with me and i moved out, I could see my two boys anytime I wanted. So after work I would go see them. Her mother would cook me a plate at their dinner time, and I would accept and hopefully to those two boys they couldn't see any change bc I was their until we put them to bed every night. She would just allow my space and time with them but also would join us and the "family" together doing everything for those two. But mom and dad knew deep down that everything has changed and isn't going to come back. But around month 3 or 4 after we broke up things changed from very slow to almost a complete 180. Bc if I called her or texted she would respond 100 of the time. Make sure Im okay and that the boys had their father. Then one day no pick up. No big deal, life happens. Then it was more and more less communication. Then I could no longer just show up. Then it was we need out days and hours, you can't just show up bc she has or wanted a life and  a better one where I was not their in her eyes everyday. But the next day is when my world shattered. Bc even tho I knew deep down she was done with me and knowing her so well I knew she could cut someone off she called best friend since first grade and would stop talking to them over 1 post on Facebook about no her or her kids but in her mind,... was 100 about her and her boys. No coming back bo matter what. End of story, new book. And my hopes and dreams where just that for myself. But when she told me I can NOT see my two boys that night then the next day it was your here to hurt my boys and I will make sure your paying child support for these 2 boys even tho I have always paid her 400 or 200 a week for almost 5 years. Maybe if I wasn't working during the winter or I was finding a new job I gave her 100 minimal but also bought her a pack or 2 packs of cigarettes a day and her wine bottle and anything she would want or spend money on I would try to pay if possible. Anyways since nobody would read this but omg i feel better even if I dont post this helping my mind I feel. But thats when I went 1 year without contact from my two boys. Leaving birthday cards and flowers balloons toys and so much stuff for the boys, for her also, and even the grandparents. But it would all stay on the step where I left it. And I can't get that year back ever. Missed birthday and holidays that I wasn't their. So I broke down, and got a lawyer, had child social services on my side I think bc I had proof of everything for a year. So is spending over 20,000 in court and lawyer BS worth it Absolutely I would tell you everyday except tonight. Tonight I remembered something from my last court day when they got my son and he would live with me now. But his older big brother, I was not the biological father and child services found this guy, and he said he would like to try and be a father to this 6 year old who doesn't know he even exist. And even tho I told this judge that I did not want them to take the brother away. That's when my lawyer had to explain to me that if they are taking one kid away bc of xyz reasons they can not leave the other kid with anyone in that house after so much was done negatively coming from this family in that house. And even tho I didn't and won't talk bad about my son's mother or his grandparents bc thats not fair and my mom taught me to never do that. But now dad 2 wants to try and be something but that lasted 1 day I think. But they had to have me on record saying yes or no to something and I can't say word for wors but saying how he will be with a foster family for now but we will all work towards having the two brothers together since that's all they know...... so 99 or 100 of people that know me or this story all day I did what had to be done for my son and so he had a father and so on. But what if I never went to court for custody Would my boys be together still to this day Would my ex have snapped out of whatever she went threw or maybe who she is or I dont have a word for her and what happened. Bc I can say crazy She is crazy. And maybe. But in her brain, if her honest thoughts were omg their father wants to harm these 2 boys i will protect them. In her mind she is a hero and did no wrong. And that will always be what's real to her no matter what. So I understand people telling me that she is in the wrong, xyz. But she also isn't. And my family thinks im crazy or to easy with her bc I won't say bad stuff or blame her or anything. But sadly, it all doesn't matter in the end. I want my son to have his best life lived. And if he wants his mother, and he does. I will do what's best for him, what's safe, and try to make sure a little boy who's 6 doesn't comprehend any of this right now and he can be mad at dad now also bc he's a mamas boy who misses his mom and dad took him away from her. But if I never go to court, would my kids life be better and have more happiness when its all said and done Nobody will know. But right now a grown ass man who's 37, and November 17th is his bday lol wtf, but he can't stop these tears from rolling down bc he believes that he isn't the hero of this story but he is the villain that people dont see only the villain knows or thinks this. And another shit feeling for me the dad, I dont have her to open up about this, and no lap to rest my head so she would rub until I feel asleep without a word bc she knew I would get upset or mad talking so she would be so patient with me and just help me sleep. And when I woke up, it was always her eyes to greet my eyes. Even if she had to hurry and run to make sure I wasn't confused when I woke up. What if I stole this persons happiness and took a part of them and without knowing or trying I ended up throwing a piece of her away that she can't get back or even remember now. And just bc I would do almost anything to make her happy over myself, I always forget and I remember with a rude awakening now of she does not want to speak with me right now. And I get she may not be herself right now. But then I remember she is done with me. Cut me off. And no words or any actions could make her forgive me or have her look at me and speak to me. That pain always sucks but tonight, I wish I never went to court that day, or maybe never meet with her and that 4 month old boy on that Halloween day where she dressed up as a minion and had that baby boy who was 4 months old, in his stroller, and changed my life that day. But what if I never show up. I'd take all that pain and more if her and those two brothers were better off without me. Lol if anyone actually reads all this.... im sorry, I had to get something out and let me no and I'll make it up to you some way. Im serious lol this weirdo with a beardo has always and will always continue to love you from a distance you can't see, where my presence isn't ever felt by you, so you can forget me and hopefully one day move on and learn to be happy with yourself. Forever and always, no matter what, my sunflower
